title: NAACP Image Awards: Fight Night, Cross and Percy Jackson Star Among First Two Waves of Winners
description: The first two waves of winners for the 56th NAACP Image Awards have been announced, and Peacock’s Fight Night: The Million Dollar Heist, Disney+’s Percy Jackson and the Olympians and Prime Video’s Cross were among the shows honored. Heading into this year’s awards, Ayo Edebiri was the most-nominated TV performer with four total nominations — […]
author: Matt Webb Mitovich
excerpt: The first wave of winners for the 56th NAACP Image Awards have been announced. See which TV shows and stars claimed prizes.
text: The first two waves of winners for the 56th NAACP Image Awards have been announced, and Peacock’s Fight Night: The Million Dollar Heist, Disney+’s Percy Jackson and the Olympians and Prime Video’s Cross were among the shows honored. Heading into this year’s awards, Ayo Edebiri was the most-nominated TV performer with four total nominations — three for her work on FX’s The Bear, and another for her memorable hosting debut on NBC’s Saturday Night Live. On Tuesday, she converted on one of those opportunities when she was named Outstanding Breakthrough Creative (Television). The most-nominated TV series overall this year is ABC’s Abbott Elementary with 10 nods, including for stars Quinta Brunson, Janelle James, Tyler James Williams, William Stanford Davis and Sheryl Lee Ralph. The NAACP Image Awards — which celebrate the accomplishments of people of color in the fields of television, music, literature and film — will air live on CBS and BET this Saturday, Feb. 22 at 8/7c. Review the first two waves of winners below (in bold and marked 🏆), and share your thoughts! OUTSTANDING COMEDY SERIESAbbott Elementary (ABC)How to Die Alone (Hulu)Poppa’s House (CBS)The Neighborhood (CBS)The Upshaws (Netflix) OUTSTANDING ACTOR IN A COMEDY SERIESCedric The Entertainer — The html:
The first two waves of winners for the 56th NAACP Image Awards have been announced, and Peacock’s Fight Night: The Million Dollar Heist, Disney+’s Percy Jackson and the Olympians and Prime Video’s Cross were among the shows honored.

Heading into this year’s awards, Ayo Edebiri was the most-nominated TV performer with four total nominations — three for her work on FX’s The Bear, and another for her memorable hosting debut on NBC’s Saturday Night Live. On Tuesday, she converted on one of those opportunities when she was named Outstanding Breakthrough Creative (Television).

The most-nominated TV series overall this year is ABC’s Abbott Elementary with 10 nods, including for stars Quinta Brunson, Janelle James, Tyler James Williams, William Stanford Davis and Sheryl Lee Ralph.

The NAACP Image Awards — which celebrate the accomplishments of people of color in the fields of television, music, literature and film — will air live on CBS and BET this Saturday, Feb. 22 at 8/7c.

Review the first two waves of winners below (in bold and marked 🏆), and share your thoughts!

OUTSTANDING COMEDY SERIES
Abbott Elementary (ABC)
How to Die Alone (Hulu)
Poppa’s House (CBS)
The Neighborhood (CBS)
The Upshaws (Netflix)

OUTSTANDING ACTOR IN A COMEDY SERIES
Cedric The Entertainer — The Neighborhood (CBS)
Damon Wayans — Poppa’s House (CBS)
David Alan Grier — St. Denis Medical (NBC)
Delroy Lindo — UnPrisoned (Hulu)
Mike Epps — The Upshaws (Netflix)
